movies.title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
movies.desc: Teen Miles Morales becomes Spider-Man of his reality, crossing his path with five counterparts from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.

movies.title: Mary Poppins Returns
movies.desc: Decades after her original visit, the magical nanny returns to help the Banks siblings and Michael's children through a difficult time in their lives.

movies.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
movies.desc: The story of the legendary rock band Queen and lead singer Freddie Mercury, leading up to their famous performance at Live Aid (1985). (Tyler didn't think this movie wouldn't be very good, but was pleasantly surprised by how well made it was)

movies.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald
movies.desc: In an effort to thwart Grindelwald's plans of raising pure-blood wizards to rule over all non-magical beings, Albus Dumbledore enlists his former student Newt Scamander, who agrees to help, though he's unaware of the dangers that lie ahead. Lines are drawn as love and loyalty are tested, even among the truest friends and family, in an increasingly divided wizarding world. (This movie was honestly kind of confusing, but it's JK Rowling, so we must)

movies.title: Hereditary
movies.desc: After the family matriarch passes away, a grieving family is haunted by tragic and disturbing occurrences, and begin to unravel dark secrets. (I never saw this, but it got good ratings online, lets check the parental review first)

movies.title: A Star Is Born
movies.desc: A musician helps a young singer find fame as age and alcoholism send his own career into a downward spiral. (I never saw this one as well, but it won an Emmy so it's got to be good! Plus, Bradley Cooper wrote, directed, and starred in it)

movies.title: Aquaman
movies.desc: Arthur Curry, the human-born heir to the underwater kingdom of Atlantis, goes on a quest to prevent a war between the worlds of ocean and land. (I'm buffer than Aquaman, remember that ;))

movies.title: Crazy Rich Asians
movies.desc: This contemporary romantic comedy, based on a global bestseller, follows native New Yorker Rachel Chu to Singapore to meet her boyfriend's family. (I never saw this one, but heard it was good).

movies.title: Venom
movies.desc: A failed reporter is bonded to an alien entity, one of many symbiotes who have invaded Earth. But the being takes a liking to Earth and decides to protect it.

movies.title: First Man
movies.desc: A look at the life of the astronaut, Neil Armstrong, and the legendary space mission that led him to become the first man to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969. (I never saw this, but it stars Ryan Gosling... so, you know ;))

movies.title: The Meg
movies.desc: A group of scientists exploring the Marianas Trench encounter the largest marine predator that has ever existed - the Megalodon. (I never saw this either, but it looks fun :))

movies.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
movies.desc: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team, along with some familiar allies, race against time after a mission gone wrong.

movies.title: Ralph Breaks the Internet
movies.desc: Six years after the events of "Wreck-It Ralph," Ralph and Vanellope, now friends, discover a wi-fi router in their arcade, leading them into a new adventure.

movies.title: Ocean's Eight
movies.desc: Debbie Ocean gathers an all-female crew to attempt an impossible heist at New York City's yearly Met Gala. (I never saw this, but it looks really good! It also came out right before you left)

movies.title: Bird Box
movies.desc: Five years after an ominous unseen presence drives most of society to suicide, a mother (Sandra Bullock) and her two children make a desperate bid to reach safety.

movies.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom
movies.desc: When the island's dormant volcano begins roaring to life, Owen and Claire mount a campaign to rescue the remaining dinosaurs from this extinction-level event.

movies.title: Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again
movies.desc: Five years after the events of Mamma Mia! (2008), Sophie prepares for the grand reopening of the Hotel Bella Donna as she learns more about her mother's past. (I never saw this, but Taylor did and has be obsessed since)

movies.title: Creed II
movies.desc: Under the tutelage of Rocky Balboa, newly crowned heavyweight champion Adonis Creed faces off against Viktor Drago, the son of Ivan Drago. (UGH SO GOOD!)

movies.title: Bumblebee
movies.desc: On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.

movies.title: Instant Family
movies.desc: A couple find themselves in over their heads when they foster three children.

movies.title: Mortal Engines
movies.desc: In a post-apocalyptic world where cities ride on wheels and consume each other to survive, two people meet in London and try to stop a conspiracy.

movies.title: Incredibles 2
movies.desc: The Incredibles hero family takes on a new mission, which involves a change in family roles: Bob Parr (Mr Incredible) must manage the house while his wife Helen (Elastigirl) goes out to save the world.

movies.title: Ant-Man and the Wasp
movies.desc: As Scott Lang balances being both a Super Hero and a father, Hope van Dyne and Dr. Hank Pym present an urgent new mission that finds the Ant-Man fighting alongside The Wasp to uncover secrets from their past.

movies.title: Night School
movies.desc: A group of high school dropouts are forced to attend night school in hope that they'll pass the GED exam to finish high school. (This stars Kevin Hart and it is SO FUNNY! I loved this movie)

movies.title: Christopher Robin
movies.desc: A working-class family man, Christopher Robin, encounters his childhood friend Winnie-the-Pooh, who helps him to rediscover the joys of life.

movies.title: Holmes & Watson
movies.desc: A humorous take on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's classic mysteries featuring Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson. (I never saw this, but it looked really funny in the previews. It stars Will Ferrell)

movies.title: Life of the Party
movies.desc: After her husband abruptly asks for a divorce, a middle-aged mother returns to college in order to complete her degree. (You wanted to see this before your mish but weren't able to, I never saw it either)

movies.title: Uncle Drew
movies.desc: An anti-ageist comedy about a man's dream to win the Rucker Classic street ball tournament in Harlem. (Lots of really famous basketball players in this one)

movies.title: The House with a Clock in Its Walls
movies.desc: A young orphan named Lewis Barnavelt aids his magical uncle in locating a clock with the power to bring about the end of the world. (This movie was honestly really weird, but had an interesting story)

movies.title: The Grinch
movies.desc: A grumpy Grinch plots to ruin Christmas for the village of Whoville.

movies.title: Book Club
movies.desc: Four lifelong friends have their lives forever changed after reading 50 Shades of Grey in their monthly book club. (I'm pretty sure you wanted to see this before your mish too, but it came out a few days after you left)

movies.title: Tag
movies.desc: A small group of former classmates organize an elaborate, annual game of tag that requires some to travel all over the country. (I always wanted to see this but never did, lets check the parental guide first)

movies.title: The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part
movies.desc: It's been five years since everything was awesome and the citizens are facing a huge new threat: Lego Duplo invaders from outer space, wrecking everything faster than they can rebuild. (The Lego Movie is like my second lover ;))

movies.title: Glass
movies.desc: Security guard David Dunn uses his supernatural abilities to track Kevin Wendell Crumb, a disturbed man who has twenty-four personalities. (I always really wanted to see this, but never have)

movies.title: Alita: Battle Angel
movies.desc: A deactivated cyborg is revived, but cannot remember anything of her past life and goes on a quest to find out who she is. (The effects in this movie are just amazing. It was one of my favorites to date)

movies.title: Fighting with My Family
movies.desc: A former wrestler and his family make a living performing at small venues around the country while his kids dream of joining World Wrestling Entertainment.

movies.title: Isn't It Romantic
movies.desc: A young woman disenchanted with love mysteriously finds herself trapped inside a romantic comedy.

movies.title: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World
movies.desc: When Hiccup discovers Toothless isn't the only Night Fury, he must seek "The Hidden World", a secret Dragon Utopia before a hired tyrant named Grimmel finds it first.

movies.title: Captain Marvel
movies.desc: Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races. (Keep in mind that this movie that this movie takes place in 1995, before any of the other Marvel movies)

movies.title: Dumbo
movies.desc: A young elephant, whose oversized ears enable him to fly, helps save a struggling circus, but when the circus plans a new venture, Dumbo and his friends discover dark secrets beneath its shiny veneer.

movies.title: Shazam!
movies.desc: We all have a superhero inside us, it just takes a bit of magic to bring it out. In Billy Batson's case, by shouting out one word - SHAZAM - this streetwise fourteen-year-old foster kid can turn into the grown-up superhero Shazam.

movies.title: The Curse of La Llorona
movies.desc: Ignoring the eerie warning of a troubled mother suspected of child endangerment, a social worker and her own small kids are soon drawn into a frightening supernatural realm. (There is almost no bad language and absolutely no sexual content in this movie, it's just really scary. I've never seen it, but heard it was pretty good)

movies.title: Avengers: Endgame
movies.desc: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe. (This is the highest grossing film of all time, and one of the best movies of all time. Let's make sure you've seen everything before this movie before we watch this one!)

movies.title: Pokémon Detective Pikachu
movies.desc: In a world where people collect Pokémon to do battle, a boy comes across an intelligent talking Pikachu who seeks to be a detective. (I'm sorry, this one HAD to go on the list)

movies.title: The Hustle
movies.desc: Anne Hathaway and Rebel Wilson star as female scam artists, one low rent and the other high class, who team up to take down the men who have wronged them.

movies.title: Aladdin
movies.desc: A kind-hearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

movies.title: Godzilla: King of the Monsters
movies.desc: The crypto-zoological agency Monarch faces off against a battery of god-sized monsters, including the mighty Godzilla, who collides with Mothra, Rodan, and his ultimate nemesis, the three-headed King Ghidorah.

movies.title: Dark Phoenix
movies.desc: Jean Grey begins to develop incredible powers that corrupt and turn her into a Dark Phoenix. Now the X-Men will have to decide if the life of a team member is worth more than all of humanity.

movies.title: Men in Black: International
movies.desc: The Men in Black have always protected the Earth from the scum of the universe. In this new adventure, they tackle their biggest threat to date: a mole in the Men in Black organization.

movies.title: Toy Story 4
movies.desc: When a new toy called "Forky" joins Woody and the gang, a road trip alongside old and new friends reveals how big the world can be for a toy.

movies.title: Spider-Man: Far from Home
movies.desc: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever.

movies.title: The Lion King
movies.desc: After the murder of his father, a young lion prince flees his kingdom only to learn the true meaning of responsibility and bravery.

movies.title: Once Upon a Time ... in Hollywood
movies.desc: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the film industry during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. (Quentin Tarantino, Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, and Margot Robbie)
